number of helpful: 21 of 28 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
5, 2016
												This game is every bit as fun as it looks (if not more)!!If you've ever shot a bow before, the aiming sensation is surprisingly accurate to the real thing. The feel of whipping an arrow out of my quiver, slapping it on the rest, and drawing back the string all in a fraction of a second is incredibly satisfying! Makes me think I'm a bona fide archery master :)My friends and I have had a ton of fun switching off and just trying to outdo each other with trick shots in the playground mode. When you attach the spectator camera to the arrow and finally peg that apple out of mid air.... mhmmm, such satisfaction!

number of helpful: 9 of 13 people (69%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
8, 2016
												I played a bunch of the archery game from the lab, loved it, decided I needed more, and bought this. I am not at all dissapointed. The game is fantastic, and I'm sure it will give me plenty of playtime. It has 5 modes: Target practice, challenge, free shoot, endless, and juggling (where you try to keep apples in the air by continually shooting them). All of them feel great, and the game provides useful stats at the conclusion like accuracy, arrows fired, score and grade. The one complaint I have is that I wish it had some kind of a high score tracker - it doesn't need to be complex, but just some way of comparing your results against previous trials. That beign said, this is a great, well-polished archery game.EDIT: The dev implemented scoreboards, rejoice!

number of helpful: 9 of 15 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
10, 2016
												20mins game play max then it gets repetitive and boring. Feels like a gimmicky game trying to cash in on the new VR market with a 'just finished enough to pass' game. Handling of the bow and items is wrong, it warps the the hand of the person, you can't move around (walking or teleporting) or i just couldn't figure it, there is only one area/map and you do everything inside of it.Game modes are basically, shoot targets, shoot targets but with limited arrows, shoot targets against a clock, shoot apples, or shoot anything you want.I like the Lab version of archery, it has a little subsistence to it where you have to protect a castle. This is just shooting a bow.I also found out it's not very finished on the gameplay side as i could hold and nocked arrow against the string and throw the bow away from me while still holding the arrow. When you let go the arrow fires as normal through the arrow rest.I would not recommend this game, I would just play the Lab instead.

content:
2016
												This game has probably the best bow mechanics of all the Vive archery games right now. The environment is pretty simple and the gamemodes are a little limited right now but what's there works really well, mechanically. The high score board keeps you coming back for more, trying to beat other people's scores as well as improve your own. The presentation is charming, the bow mechanics are excellent, and with more content & modes this will easily be the best archery experience for VR.

												To me, having played Bowslinger before The Lab, I felt disappointed in Valve's Bowslinging.It has a totally charming environment, the bow and arrows feel so much more natural and accurate to me than The Lab demo.If you enjoy shooting a bow & arrow, buy this game!

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
ber 4, 2016
												How to play 'Bowslinger' correctly.Step 1 - Uninstall 'Bowslinger'Step 2 - Install 'The Lab' for FREEStep 3 - Play 'The Lab's bow mini-gameStep 4 - Feel ripped off for paying $10 for less of a game than Valve's FREE minigame.Seriously, this game forgot to include the game. It has several modes. All of which are boring. Shoot stationary targets within a time limit; shoot stationary targets without a time limit; shoot an arrow at an apple repeatedly, and shoot ONE stationary target lots of times. There is no real GAME here. You have the protential in a VR game to throw in some random crazy fun stuff, and you didnt. Archery is fun. I know this because i do archery IRL and its great. This really isnt. You cant even enjoy attempting to master it as the controls are terribly poor. Overly complex given the simplistic nature of 'Bowslinger', meaning you miss fire or fail to load your bow far too often. Given the potential of the medium, this is just massively underwhelming and the bearest excuse of a game. If you want bow and arrow goodness use 'The Lab' or for gun and fun shooty goodness, have a look at VR Skeet, also free on Steam, and is able of how make stuff fun and entertaining if not realistic.TL;DR - Save your money and play the minigame in 'The Lab'. Much more entertaining.

												There is almost no content here. Same enviroment the entire game, you can't even move out of the starting spot. Same patterns every round, game is more about memorizing than archery. Soundtrack consists of a single track. You can't really aim because it makes you want to place draw string to your face, but you have a headset on so you bash your controllers a lot. There are better and cheeper archery games out for Vive. Why buy this one?graphics: 4/10sound: 2/10replayability: 1/10fun: 1/10Only game I ever refunded.

25, 2016
												If you like archery games, this one is pretty fun. It's got a good bow mechanic (currently the beta has a "two-handed" control model, like The Lab's archery game). There's a placeable (optional) 3rd person camera for the mirrored screen that works well with spectators. It could use some more modes/environments, but it's pretty solid for an indie VR title.

2016
												I'll admit I haven't played this nearly as much as other Vive titles, but I still recommend it. The bow mechanics feel nice, the graphics are nice, and it's a more relaxed alternative to other Vive archery experiences. The devs seem to be listening and adding features too, which should be encouraged. For £11 you can't go wrong.
